channel.title: Add Model button!
channel.description:
[center][size=13pt]Okay First off this has been done but i made it a button![/size]
Credits :
ritz929 - For the add model code Mr.Gangster - For making it a button |---------------------------------------------------------------|
Desctiption : To add a "Add Models" button to your Jframe
Difficulty : You should be smacked if you can't complete it 1/10
Assumed Knowledge : Follow Instructions
Tested Client : Amazon Client V1.5
Files/Classes Modified : Client.Java, GUI.java
Ok lets get started...
First Open your [code]GUI.java[/code]
and search for. [code]JMenu fileMenu = new JMenu("File");[/code]
then add. [code] JButton modelMenu = new JButton("Add Models"); modelMenu.setActionCommand("Add Models"); modelMenu.addActionListener(this);[/code]
Next search for [code]menuBar.add(fileMenu);[/code]
Then add [code]menuBar.add(modelMenu);[/code]
Next you have to search for a command so i suggest to search for [code]if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase[/code]
Under the last } of one of them codes add [code]if (cmd.equalsIgnoreCase("add models")) { models(); }[/code]
Now Save & Close your GUI.
Now open your Client.java and find your add model command so search [code]if(s.startswith("add model")[/code]
Now delete that WHOLE CODE!!
Now at the top of your client.java find [code]public class client extends Applet_Sub1 {[/code]
and underneath that add [code]public void models() {
for(int anIntX = 0; anIntX < 40000; anIntX++) { byte[] abyte0 = GetModel(anIntX); if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0){ aClass14Array970[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, anIntX); method77("Model added successfully!", 0, "", aBoolean991);
} } }[/code]
Now close and save your Client.java and compile your client...
Now your finished and you should have a "Add Model" Button on your Jframe!
Here is a video to show that it works!
[URL=http://"http://img532.imageshack.us/my.php?image=addmodelef5.flv"]CLICK HERE TO VIEW THE VIDEO![/URL][/center]

item.title: Add Model button!
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“johnj98, post:21, topic:222333”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=292011.msg2362910#msg2362910 date=1217745882]

Lol not to be ignorant but…

Any client without a jframe at least is g@y

What about a client that uses a Frame? It’s personal preference if you use javax.swing or java.awt’s graphical components.

At tutorial: this fails in so many ways.

  1. Your code format sucks, why center everything?
  2. Learn to name, following the Java Naming Conventions.
  3. Why loop like that? It saves code and adds efficiency if you were to loop through the models like this (note: I am not sure how you load models, so you will have to do it. I am only going on how I think the client loads it):

File models = new File("./path/to/models/"); if(models.isDirectory()) { try { File[] files = models.listFiles(); for(int i = 0; i < files.length; i++) { byte[] data = new byte[(int) files[i].length()]; DataInputStream in = new DataInputStream(new FileInputStream(files[i])); in.readFully(data); Class14Array970[1].method234(data.length, data, (byte)2, i); in.close(); } } catch(IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }
4) Why do you set the action command to ‘Add Models’ when it will already be that by default?
[/quote]
umm… What source are you using…
i also i agree with him everyone centers EVERYTHING…[/quote]
I’m not using any source, what does that have to do with anything I posted?

Read full topic
